name: TheAtlantic
text:
A mental health crisis is looming as the American West burns.

Many wildfire survivors told @jdkstern13 they felt "haunted" and "disturbed" by the recurring fires. "As irrational as they knew it was, they felt as though the fires were stalking them." https://t.co/61G8mlPSbC

name: TheAtlantic
text: It's common for people in middle age to feel spiritual stirrings, even if they've been nonreligious for some time. @arthurbrooks writes that this change in identity can be scary—but with faith or anything else, it's healthy to let ourselves change: https://t.co/qgge11vMWd

name: TheAtlantic
text: "There were signs that this agreement was coming, and that the Trump administration would be uniquely suited to making it happen," @gcaw writes: https://t.co/4mar4mEKeZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Rather than a moderating presence in the White House, Jared Kushner has often served as Trump's most dangerous enabler. "It’s a role that he thrives at playing, because he’s spent his whole life rehearsing for it," @FranklinFoer writes. https://t.co/vCwd5SYw0D

name: TheAtlantic
text: Through the transformation of religious sites, India’s and Turkey’s leaders are recasting once-secular republics into fully fledged ethnonationalist states, writes @YasmeenSerhan: https://t.co/uo9OnX95wX

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The absence of a government plan to deal with the economic crisis, along with the second wave of COVID-19, has triggered an enraged and joyful youth revolt, mostly middle-class kids fighting for a receding Israeli dream," @YKleinHalevi writes: https://t.co/RFofQT7SNz

name: TheAtlantic
text: Satirizing capitalism is nothing new. But amid a pandemic that has revealed the brutal calculus of “essential work,” fiction that grimly skewers corporate exploitation carries new resonance. @madelesque writes: https://t.co/cfmAKRGooi

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos: California’s Fast-Moving Lake Fire—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/wwe4cBCA9f

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Why did everyone do so much work in April and May," @PinskyElizabeth asks, "if our youngest citizens, whose vulnerability to threats other than the coronavirus is so great, can’t reap the benefits in the fall?" https://t.co/ngvDHcARdQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Whatever Kanye West's emotional or mental status is from moment to moment, his campaign must, on some level, be thought of as real. @skornhaber dissects the rapper's presidential bid and quest for power https://t.co/nVJ5BFjMqL

name: TheAtlantic
text: Contrary to President Trump’s claims, the USPS has both the money and the capacity to deal with a surge in mail-in ballots. But new policies could still get in the way of the election, @RussellBerman reports. https://t.co/W0AYh6PQk2

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I’m not sure I know what crazy looks like, but even today when I hear the word, I picture a split screen, the dreadlocked man in Kejetia on one side, my mother lying in bed on the other." Read an excerpt from Yaa Gyasi's forthcoming novel: https://t.co/3K0JYtZ4Gv

name: TheAtlantic
text: With his actions toward the Postal Service, President Trump is once again conscripting the executive branch to serve his immediate interests, writes @RonBrownstein: https://t.co/i9SIkQiFDt

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos of the Week: Antarctic Sunrise, Suspended Cabin, Shanghai Lightning—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/hLLkp37YxS

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @IsaacDovere: "Trump’s attempts to manipulate the census may provide the most revealing measure of just how much he’s willing to distort federal operations to benefit himself and his party—and how far congressional Republicans will go in abetting him." - @RonBrownstein https://t.co/jYe0z7KCbU

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Which country—Germany or the United States—would be more likely to rescue me if I got stuck in some foreign country in the middle of a perilous political crisis?" @Yascha_Mounk writes: https://t.co/9ZfneCrLAT

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @edyong209: This is an incredibly important story that I urge you to read. 

By @alexismadrigal and @yayitsrob, who've been at the very forefront of our pandemic coverage.

name: TheAtlantic
text: "A certain variety of American citizen just can’t seem to wrap his mind around the U.S. Constitution’s provisions guaranteeing equal citizenship to all Americans," Garrett Epps writes: https://t.co/Ovef67q1CV
